method:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
2. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, curry powder, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
4. Stir in the cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
2. Add the fish and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, curry powder, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through.
4. Stir in the cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
2. Add the fish and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, curry powder, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through.
4. Stir in the cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.
Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then grill or bake. Simmer tomato sauce and cream with more spices, then add chicken and serve over rice.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger, then add beef and brown. Add curry powder and coconut milk, then simmer until beef is tender. Serve over rice.
Sauté vegetables with spices and ghee, then add rice and cook until tender. Layer rice and vegetables, then top with yogurt and serve.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger, then add prawns and cook until pink. Add korma spice blend and coconut cream, then simmer until prawns are cooked through. Serve over rice.
Mix ground beef with onion, tomato, spices, and egg, then form into patties and grill or fry. Serve with chutney and naan bread.
Blend mango, yogurt, milk, sugar, and cardamom until smooth, then serve chilled.
Sauté chicken, onion, and bell pepper, then add tomato and spices. Simmer until chicken is cooked through, then serve over rice.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry for 2-3 minutes.
2. Add chicken and fry until golden brown. Add salt to taste.
3. Add yogurt and simmer on low heat until the chicken is cooked through.
4. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry for 2-3 minutes.
2. Add tomatoes and fry until they are soft.
3. Add fish and fry for 5-6 minutes on medium heat.
4. Add water and simmer on low heat until the fish is cooked through.
5. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry for 2-3 minutes.
2. Add mixed vegetables and fry for 5-6 minutes on medium heat.
3. Add rice and fry for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and salt to taste, and cook until the rice is done.
5. Serve hot with raita and papadum.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry for 2-3 minutes.
2. Add tomatoes and fry until they are soft.
3. Add mutton and fry for 10-15 minutes on medium heat.
4. Add water and salt to taste, and simmer on low heat until the mutton is cooked through.
5. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry for 2-3 minutes.
2. Add tomatoes and fry until they are soft.
3. Add chickpeas and fry for 5-6 minutes on medium heat.
4. Add water and salt to taste.

Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add the ginger and garlic paste and fry for a minute. Add the tomato paste and fry for another minute. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Add the fish fillets and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the fish is cooked through. Serve with rice.

Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add the ginger and garlic paste and fry for a minute. Add the tomato paste and fry for another minute. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder and salt. Add the beef and fry for a few minutes. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 1 hour until the beef is tender.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small pieces
method: Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add the ginger and garlic paste and fry for a minute. Add the tomato paste and fry for another minute. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Add the chicken and fry for a few minutes. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. Add the yogurt and stir well. Serve with naan or rice.

cooking_method: 1. Marinate the mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, red chili powder, and salt. Leave it for 1 hour. 2. Wash the rice and soak it for 30 minutes. 3. Heat ghee and oil in a large pot. Add sliced onion and fry until golden brown. 4. Add bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Fry for a few seconds. 5. Add marinated mutton and fry for 10-15 minutes. 6. Add enough water to cover the mutton and bring it to a boil. 7. Cover the pot and cook until the mutton is tender. 8. Remove the mutton and set aside. 9. Strain the stock and measure it. You will need twice as much water as rice. 10. Heat ghee and oil in a large pot. Add rice and fry for a few minutes. 11. Add the strained stock, salt, and rose water. Bring it to a boil. 12. Cover the pot and cook until the rice is done. 13. Layer the rice and mutton in a large pot. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients: 2 lbs. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
method:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Cook for another minute.
5. Add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, coconut milk, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve over rice and garnish with fresh cilantro, if desired.

ingredients: 1 lb. beef sirloin, cut into thin strips
Egg noodles or rice, for serving
method:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
2. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid, about 5 minutes.
4. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Cook for another minute.
5. Gradually add the beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes.
6. Stir in the sour cream and Dijon mustard. Return the beef to the skillet and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
7. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
method:
1. In a small bowl, mix together chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and salt.
2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and spice mixture and cook until chicken is no longer pink.
3. Heat tortillas according to package directions.
4. To assemble tacos, place chicken in tortillas and top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, and sour cream.

1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add onion and garlic and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
2. Add bell pepper, carrots, snow peas, and mushrooms and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes, until vegetables are tender-crisp.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, cornstarch, ginger, and red pepper flakes. Add to skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until sauce thickens.
4. Serve over cooked rice.

1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the chickpeas, carrots, sweet potato, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, curry powder, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
3. Stir in the cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

1. Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup of the pasta cooking water.
2. While the spaghetti cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped bacon and cook until crispy, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the Parmesan cheese, egg yolks, salt, and black pepper.
4. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the cooked spaghetti and Parmesan mixture. Toss well to combine, adding the reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
5. Serve with chopped parsley sprinkled on top.
